title: Mini Tiller Procurement Corruption Case in Lumbini Province
description:
The Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority (CIAA) filed a corruption case at the Special Court, Kathmandu, against five individuals, including Baikuntha Adhikari, the then-Secretary of the Ministry of Land Management, Agriculture, and Cooperatives of Lumbini Province. The case, filed on April 19, 2022, concerns irregularities in the procurement of mini tillers for farmers during the fiscal year 2018-2019 (2075/76 BS).

The accused are charged with causing a total loss of NPR 4,337,500 to the provincial government. The allegations center on the 'Agricultural Mechanization Program' run by the then-Province No. 5 (now Lumbini Province). The scheme involved two primary methods of fraud:

  • Substandard Equipment: The supplier, Aadhunik Krishi Kisan Sansar Pvt. Ltd., allegedly delivered cheaper, lower-quality Chinese mini tillers instead of the contracted Indian-made models. This substitution is reported to have caused a loss of NPR 3,715,000.
  • Fraudulent Billing: The accused are also alleged to have created fake invoices and processed duplicate payments for seven mini tillers, misappropriating an additional NPR 622,500.

Government officials, including Secretary Adhikari, Division Chief Shreedhar Gyawali, and Officer Mukesh Ramjali Nepali, are accused of approving payments without conducting proper verification of documents or field inspections, thereby indicating collusion with the supplier, Rajaram Tiwari. At the time the case was filed, Adhikari was serving as a Secretary in a different ministry within Lumbini Province and was automatically suspended upon indictment.
unverified_info: The final verdict or the current status of the case proceedings at the Special Court, Kathmandu, is not available in the provided sources.

timeline.title: Irregular Procurement Period Begins
timeline.description: The procurement of mini tillers under the 'Agricultural Mechanization Program' for the fiscal year 2075/76 (2018-2019) began, during which the alleged irregularities occurred.

timeline.title: CIAA Files Corruption Case
timeline.description: The CIAA filed a charge sheet at the Special Court, Kathmandu against five individuals and one company, alleging a total corruption amount of NPR 4,337,500.

timeline.title: Secretary Automatically Suspended
timeline.description: Baikuntha Adhikari, then-Secretary of the Ministry of Agriculture, Food Technology and Land Management for Lumbini Province, was automatically suspended from his post following the filing of the corruption case.
